00139 //**************************************************************************
00140 //
00141 // DbgGetLogFileName
00142 //
00143 //          
00144 //
00145 // Parameter List :
00146 // Return Value :
00147 // Modification history :
00148 //
00149 //          xxjun98:CJC       -> creation
00150 //
00151 //**************************************************************************
00152 BOOLEAN DbgGetLogFileName( STRING512 pcName )
00153 {
00154       // use the provided buffer to get the directory name, then tack on
00155       // "\debug.txt"
00156 #ifndef _NO_DEBUG_TXT
00157       if ( ! GetExecutableDirectory( pcName ) )
00158       {
00159             return( FALSE );
00160       }
00161 
00162       if ( strlen( pcName ) > (512 - strlen( "\\debug.txt" ) - 1 ) )
00163       {
00164             // no room!
00165             return( FALSE );
00166       }
00167 
00168       strcat( pcName, "\\debug.txt" );
00169 #endif
00170 
00171       return( TRUE );
00172 }

00175 //**************************************************************************
00176 //
00177 // DbgInitialize
00178 //
00179 //          
00180 //
00181 // Parameter List :
00182 // Return Value :
00183 // Modification history :
00184 //
00185 //          xxnov96:HJH       -> creation
00186 //
00187 //**************************************************************************
00188 
00189 BOOLEAN DbgInitialize(void)
00190 {
00191       INT32 iX;
00192 
00193       for( iX = 0; iX < MAX_TOPICS_ALLOTED; iX++ )
00194       {
00195             gpDbgTopicPtrs[iX] = NULL;
00196       }
00197 
00198       DbgClearAllTopics();
00199 
00200       gfRecordToFile = TRUE;
00201       gfRecordToDebugger = TRUE;
00202       gubAssertString[0] = '\0';
00203 
00204 #ifndef _NO_DEBUG_TXT
00205       if (! DbgGetLogFileName( gpcDebugLogFileName ) )
00206       {
00207             return( FALSE );
00208       }
00209       // clear debug text file out
00210       RemoveDebugText( );
00211 #endif
00212 
00213       return(TRUE);
00214 }

00229 
00230 void DbgShutdown(void)
00231 {
00232       DbgMessageReal( (UINT16)(-1), CLIENT_SHUTDOWN, 0, "SGP Going Down" );
00233 }

00236 //**************************************************************************
00237 //
00238 // DbgTopicRegistration
00239 //
00240 //
00241 // Parameter List :
00242 // Return Value :
00243 // Modification history :
00244 //
00245 //          June 97: BR       -> creation
00246 //
00247 //**************************************************************************
00248 
00249 void DbgTopicRegistration( UINT8 ubCmd, UINT16 *usTopicID, CHAR8 *zMessage )
00250 {
00251       UINT16 usIndex,usUse;
00252       BOOLEAN fFound;
00253 
00254       if ( usTopicID == NULL )
00255             return;
00256 
00257       if( ubCmd == TOPIC_REGISTER )
00258       {
00259             usUse = INVALID_TOPIC;
00260             fFound = FALSE;
00261             for( usIndex = 0; usIndex < MAX_TOPICS_ALLOTED && !fFound; usIndex++)
00262             {
00263                   if ( !gfDebugTopics[usIndex] )
00264                   {
00265                         fFound = TRUE;
00266                         usUse = usIndex;
00267                   }
00268             }
00269 
00270             gfDebugTopics[ usUse ] = TRUE;
00271             *usTopicID = usUse;
00272             gpDbgTopicPtrs[usUse] = usTopicID;
00273             DbgMessageReal(usUse, TOPIC_MESSAGE, DBG_LEVEL_0, zMessage );
00274       }
00275       else if( ubCmd == TOPIC_UNREGISTER )
00276       {
00277             if ( *usTopicID >= MAX_TOPICS_ALLOTED )
00278                   return;
00279 
00280             DbgMessageReal( *usTopicID, TOPIC_MESSAGE, DBG_LEVEL_0, zMessage );
00281             gfDebugTopics[ *usTopicID ] = FALSE;
00282 
00283 
00284             if (gpDbgTopicPtrs[ *usTopicID ] != NULL )
00285             {
00286                   gpDbgTopicPtrs[ *usTopicID ] = NULL;
00287             }
00288 
00289             *usTopicID = INVALID_TOPIC;
00290       }
00291 }

00301 {
00302       DeleteFile( gpcDebugLogFileName );
00303 }

00306 //**************************************************************************
00307 //
00308 // DbgClearAllTopics
00309 //
00310 //
00311 // Parameter List :
00312 // Return Value :
00313 // Modification history :
00314 //
00315 //          June 97: BR       -> creation
00316 //
00317 //**************************************************************************
00318 
00319 void DbgClearAllTopics( void )
00320 {
00321       UINT16 usIndex;
00322 
00323       for( usIndex = 0; usIndex < MAX_TOPICS_ALLOTED; usIndex++)
00324       {
00325             gfDebugTopics[ usIndex ] = FALSE;
00326             if ( gpDbgTopicPtrs[ usIndex ] != NULL )
00327             {
00328                   *gpDbgTopicPtrs[usIndex] = INVALID_TOPIC;
00329                   gpDbgTopicPtrs[usIndex] = NULL;
00330             }
00331       }
00332 }

00338 //
00339 //

00343 // Modification history :
00344 //
00345 //          xxnov96:HJH       -> creation
00346 //
00347 //**************************************************************************
00348 template void DbgMessageReal<unsigned char *>(UINT16, UINT8, UINT8, unsigned char *);
00349 template <typename type4>
00350 void DbgMessageReal(UINT16 uiTopicId, UINT8 uiCommand, UINT8 uiDebugLevel, type4 strMessage)
00351 {
00352 #ifndef _NO_DEBUG_TXT
00353   FILE      *OutFile;
00354 #endif
00355 
00356       // Check for a registered topic ID
00357       if ( uiTopicId < MAX_TOPICS_ALLOTED )//&& gfDebugTopics[uiTopicId] )
00358       {
00359             OutputDebugString ( (LPCSTR) strMessage );
00360             OutputDebugString ( "\n" );
00361 
00362 //add _NO_DEBUG_TXT to your SGP preprocessor definitions to avoid this f**king huge file from 
00363 //slowly growing behind the scenes!!!!
00364 #ifndef _NO_DEBUG_TXT
00365             if ((OutFile = fopen(gpcDebugLogFileName, "a+t")) != NULL)
00366             { 
00367                   fprintf(OutFile, "%s\n", strMessage);
00368                   fclose(OutFile);
00369             }
00370 #endif
00371       }
00372 
00373 }

00407 
00408 void DbgFailedAssertion( BOOLEAN fExpression, char *szFile, int nLine )
00409 {
00410 #ifndef _NO_DEBUG_TXT
00411   FILE *OutFile;
00412 
00413       if ( fExpression == FALSE )
00414       {
00415             if ((OutFile = fopen(gpcDebugLogFileName, "a+t")) != NULL)
00416             { 
00417               fprintf(OutFile, "Assertion Failed at:\n    line %i\n    %s\n", nLine, szFile);
00418           fclose(OutFile);
00419             }
00420       }
00421 #endif
00422 }

00440 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00441 // Wiz8 compatible debug messaging
00442 
00443 void              _DebugMessage(UINT8 *pString, UINT32 uiLineNum, UINT8 *pSourceFile)
00444 {
00445       UINT8 ubOutputString[512];
00446 #ifndef _NO_DEBUG_TXT
00447       FILE *DebugFile;
00448 #endif
00449 
00450       //
00451       // Build the output string
00452       //
00453 
00454       sprintf( (char *) ubOutputString, "{ %ld } %s [Line %d in %s]\n", GetTickCount(), pString, uiLineNum, pSourceFile );
00455 
00456       //
00457       // Output to debugger
00458       //
00459 
00460       if (gfRecordToDebugger)
00461       {
00462             OutputDebugString( (LPCSTR) ubOutputString );
00463       }
00464 
00465       //
00466       // Record to file if required
00467       //
00468 
00469 #ifndef _NO_DEBUG_TXT
00470       if (gfRecordToFile)
00471       {
00472             if ((DebugFile = fopen( gpcDebugLogFileName, "a+t" )) != NULL)
00473             {
00474                   fputs( (const char *)ubOutputString, DebugFile );
00475                   fclose( DebugFile );
00476             }
00477       }
00478 #endif
00479 }

00489 extern HVOBJECT FontObjs[25];
00490 
00491 #ifdef JA2 //JAGGED ALLIANCE 2 VERSION ONLY
00492 template void _FailMessage<char *, char const *>(char *, unsigned int, char const *);
00493 template void _FailMessage<char const *, char const *>(char const *, unsigned int, char const *);
00494 template void _FailMessage<int, char const *>(int, unsigned int, char const *);
00495 template void _FailMessage<int, char *>(int, unsigned int, char *);
00496 template void _FailMessage<char *, char *>(char *, unsigned int, char *);
00497 // template void _FailMessage<char *, char *>(unsigned char *, unsigned int, char *);
00498 template void _FailMessage<unsigned char *, char const *>(unsigned char *, unsigned int, char const *);
00499 template <typename type1, typename type2>
00500 void _FailMessage( type1 pString, UINT32 uiLineNum, type2 pSourceFile )
00501 { 
00502       MSG Message;
00503       UINT8 ubOutputString[512];
00504 #ifndef _NO_DEBUG_TXT
00505       FILE *DebugFile;
00506 #endif
00507       BOOLEAN fDone = FALSE;
00508       //Build the output strings
00509       sprintf( (char *)ubOutputString, "{ %ld } Assertion Failure [Line %d in %s]\n", GetTickCount(), uiLineNum, pSourceFile );
00510       if( pString )
00511             sprintf( (char *)gubAssertString, (const char *)pString );  
00512       else
00513             sprintf( (char *)gubAssertString, "" );
00514 
00515       //Output to debugger
00516       if (gfRecordToDebugger)
00517             OutputDebugString( (LPCSTR)ubOutputString );
00518       
00519       //Record to file if required
00520 #ifndef _NO_DEBUG_TXT
00521       if (gfRecordToFile)
00522       {
00523             if ((DebugFile = fopen( gpcDebugLogFileName, "a+t" )) != NULL)
00524             {
00525                   fputs( (const char *)ubOutputString, DebugFile );
00526                   fclose( DebugFile );
00527             }
00528       }
00529       
00530 #if 0
00531       if( !FontObjs[0] )
00532       { //Font manager hasn't yet been initialized so use the windows error system
00533             sprintf( gubErrorText, "Assertion Failure -- Line %d in %s", uiLineNum, pSourceFile );
00534             MessageBox( NULL, gubErrorText, "Jagged Alliance 2", MB_OK );
00535             gfProgramIsRunning = FALSE;
00536             return;
00537       }
00538 #endif
00539 
00540       //Kris:
00541       //NASTY HACK, THE GAME IS GOING TO DIE ANYWAY, SO WHO CARES WHAT WE DO.
00542       //This will actually bring up a screen that prints out the assert message
00543       //until the user hits esc or alt-x.
00544       sprintf( (char *)gubErrorText, "Assertion Failure -- Line %d in %s", uiLineNum, pSourceFile );
00545       SetPendingNewScreen( ERROR_SCREEN );
00546       SetCurrentScreen( ERROR_SCREEN );
00547       while (gfProgramIsRunning)
00548       {
00549             if (PeekMessage(&Message, NULL, 0, 0, PM_NOREMOVE))
00550             { // We have a message on the WIN95 queue, let's get it
00551                   if (!GetMessage(&Message, NULL, 0, 0))
00552                   { // It's quitting time
00553                         continue;
00554                   }
00555                   // Ok, now that we have the message, let's handle it
00556                   TranslateMessage(&Message);
00557                   DispatchMessage(&Message);      
00558             }
00559             else
00560             { // Windows hasn't processed any messages, therefore we handle the rest
00561                   GameLoop();        
00562                   gfSGPInputReceived  =  FALSE;             
00563             }
00564       }
00565 #endif
00566       exit(0);
00567 }
00568 
00569 #else //NOT JAGGED ALLIANCE 2
00570 
00571 void _FailMessage(UINT8 *pString, UINT32 uiLineNum, UINT8 *pSourceFile)
00572 {
00573       UINT8 ubOutputString[512];
00574       BOOLEAN fDone = FALSE;
00575 
00576 #ifndef _NO_DEBUG_TXT
00577       FILE *DebugFile;
00578 #endif
00579 
00580 
00581       // Build the output string
00582       sprintf( ubOutputString, "{ %ld } Assertion Failure: %s [Line %d in %s]\n", GetTickCount(), pString, uiLineNum, pSourceFile );
00583       if( pString )
00584             sprintf( gubAssertString, pString );
00585       // Output to debugger
00586       if (gfRecordToDebugger)
00587       {
00588             OutputDebugString( ubOutputString );
00589             if( pString )
00590             { //tag on the assert message
00591                   OutputDebugString( gubAssertString );
00592             }
00593       }
00594       // Record to file if required
00595 #ifndef _NO_DEBUG_TXT
00596       if (gfRecordToFile)
00597       {
00598             if ((DebugFile = fopen( gpcDebugLogFileName, "a+t" )) != NULL)
00599             {
00600                   fputs( ubOutputString, DebugFile );
00601                   if( pString )
00602                   { //tag on the assert message
00603                         fputs( gubAssertString, DebugFile );
00604                   }
00605                   fclose( DebugFile );
00606             }
00607       }
00608 #endif
00609       exit( 0 );
00610 }
00611 
00612 #endif
00613 
00614 #endif
00615 
00616 // This is NOT a _DEBUG only function! It is also needed in
00617 // release mode builds. -- DB
00618 UINT8 *String(const char *String, ...)
00619 {
00620 
00621   va_list  ArgPtr;
00622   UINT8    usIndex;
00623 
00624   // Record string index. This index is used since we live in a multitasking environment. 
00625   // It is still not bulletproof, but it's better than a single string
00626   usIndex = gubStringIndex++;
00627   if (gubStringIndex == 8)
00628   { // reset string pointer
00629     gubStringIndex = 0;
00630   }
00631 
00632   va_start(ArgPtr, String);
00633   vsprintf((char *) gbTmpDebugString[usIndex], String, ArgPtr);
00634   va_end(ArgPtr);
00635 
00636   return gbTmpDebugString[usIndex];
00637 
00638 }
